Annotation.note:
The paper [BIB/Czapor_91a] discusses several lex. Groebner heuristics. Normal selection is usually bad. Better pair selection strategies order S-polynomials either by their degree or by their expected degree.
It discusses the following examples:
Trinks as Problem 1 Katsura_5 as Problem 2 Czapor-87_2 as Problem 3 Butcher as Problem 5 Hairer_2 as Problem 6 Hairer_2_1 as Problem 6 Cyclic_5 as Problem 7 Cyclic_7_1 as Problem 8 Caprasse as Problem 9 Fee_3 as Problem 10 Katsura_6 as Problem 11 Cyclic_5_1 as Problem 13 Cyclic_6 as Problem 14
